get.description:
Lists all subaccounts of this account You may select the active subaccount for any API request by using a HTTP header or query string parameter to specify the subaccount ID as follows: 
https://uptime.com/api/v1/dashboard/?subaccount=123
or 
curl -H "X-Subaccount: 123" -H "Authorization: token xxxx" https://uptime.com/api/v1/dashboard/

post.description:
Creates a new subaccount

Creates a new subaccount for this account which includes one pack which is deducted from the main account.

get.description: Get subaccount details

patch.description: Renames subaccount

post.description:
Transfers packs to subaccount from main account and vice versa

If num is positive packs are transferred from main account to subaccount. If num is negative
packs are deducted from subaccount and added to the main account.
Returns access token upon successful token validation

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The last day to show statistics for in ISO 8601 (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ) format.

get.description: Lists the parameters available for every type of check
Lists all locations available for checks
Get a single check

patch.description: Partially update a check

Add additional contacts to a check **Sample data (application/x-www-form-urlencoded):** 
contact_groups[0]=Default&contact_groups[1]=Other

**Sample data (JSON):** {"contact_groups": ["Default", "Other"]}

Add additional locations to a check **Sample data (application/x-www-form-urlencoded):** 
locations[0]=GBR&locations[1]=AUT

**Sample data (JSON):** {"locations": ["GBR", "AUT"]}

Add additional tags to a check **Sample data (application/x-www-form-urlencoded):** 
tags[0]=One&tags[1]=Two

**Sample data (JSON):** {"tags": ["One", "Two"]}

get.description: Shows the real-time analysis data - location status and recent alerts per location
Shows the current check state and latest downtime event for a check

patch.description:
Replace all contacts on a check **Sample data (application/x-www-form-urlencoded):** 
contact_groups[0]=Default&contact_groups[1]=Other

**Sample data (JSON):** {"contact_groups": ["Default", "Other"]}

Replace all locations on a check **Sample data (application/x-www-form-urlencoded):** 
locations[0]=GBR&locations[1]=AUT

**Sample data (JSON):** {"locations": ["GBR", "AUT"]}

Replace all tags on a check **Sample data (application/x-www-form-urlencoded):** 
tags[0]=One&tags[1]=Two

**Sample data (JSON):** {"tags": ["One", "Two"]}

post.description:
Register a new device for push notifications

**NOTE: This API is only available to the Uptime.com mobile app.**
Register your device via the mobile app and it will automatically appear
in the list.

**NOTE 2:** This endpoint will overwrite any existing registered
device with the same UUID, if it exists.

get.description:
Get a single registered push notification device

**NOTE** You may identify the object by PK or UUID

parameters.name: pk
parameters.description: You may specify a `pk` or `uuid`.

put.description:
Update the device name and associated contacts for a push notification device

**NOTE** You may identify the object by PK or UUID

parameters.description: You may specify a `pk` or `uuid`.

patch.description:
Partially update the device name or associated contacts for a push notification device

**NOTE** You may identify the object by PK or UUID

parameters.description: You may specify a `pk` or `uuid`.

delete.description:
Delete a registered push notification device

**NOTE** You may identify the object by PK or UUID

name.description: Name of this contact

sms_list.description: Array of cellphone numbers for SMS alerts (valid international phone number starting with +)

email_list.description: Array of email addresses to receive alerts

phonecall_list.description: Array of cellphone numbers for voice call alerts (valid international phone number starting with +)

integrations.description: Array of integration names or IDs associated with this contact

push_notification_profiles.description: Array of integration names or IDs associated with this contact

oncall_schedule.description: The on-call hours schedule for this contact

state.description: Whether to use an on-call schedule. Either ACTIVE (always on call) or SCHEDULED (use defined schedule).

schedule.description: The schedule entries for when the contact is on-call; see example above.

services_tags.description: Include checks with one or more of the selected tags

name.description: The displayed name for this dashboard

is_pinned.description: Whether this dashboard is pinned to the sidebar

metrics_show_section.description: Show/hide the Summary Metrics section at the top of this dashboard

metrics_for_all_checks.description: Include metrics from all checks, not just the selected checks

services_show_section.description: Show/hide the check cards from this dashboard

services_num_to_show.description: Number of check cards to show in the Checks section

services_include_up.description: Include/exclude checks which are currently up

services_include_down.description: Include/exclude checks which are currently down

services_include_paused.description: Include/exclude checks which are currently paused

services_include_maintenance.description: Include/exclude checks which are manually marked for maintenance

services_primary_sort.description: The primary value for ordering the checks

services_secondary_sort.description: The secondary value for ordering the checks, if the primary value is the same

services_show_uptime.description: Show the 24h uptime percentage on each check card

services_show_response_time.description: Show the response time graph or metric on each check card

alerts_show_section.description: Show/hide the Latest Alerts section from this dashboard

alerts_for_all_checks.description: Show/hide alerts globally across all checks, rather than only for checks selected in the Checks tab

alerts_include_ignored.description: Include/exclude alerts marked as "ignored" in the alerts listing

alerts_include_resolved.description: Include/exclude alerts that are no longer down in the alerts listing

alerts_num_to_show.description: Number of alerts to show in the Latest Alerts section

jira_subdomain.description: The domain your company uses to access Jira, e.g. "https://your-domain.atlassian.net"

project_key.description: The project key of your Service Desk project, shown on the Project Settings > Details page. E.g. "SMPSRVDESK"

labels.description: A comma separated list of labels attached to each incident created. The "Uptime.com" label any associated check tags are always set.

custom_field_id_account_name.description: An optional ID for a custom text field that should receive the account name.

custom_field_id_check_name.description: An optional ID for a custom text field that should receive the check name.

custom_field_id_check_url.description: An optional ID for a custom text field that should receive the check URL.

custom_fields_json.description:
Advanced configuration for custom fields using JSON format. See example values. 

  {
    "customfield_10000": "this is a text field",
    "customfield_20000": "this is a multi-line text field. big text.",
    "customfield_30000": "2011-07-13T15:25:00",
    "customfield_40000": {
      "value": "this is a select list value"
    },
    "customfield_50000": {
      "name": "this is a group picker value"
    },
    "customfield_60000": [
      {"value": "this is a multi select list value #1"},
      {"value": "this is a multi select list value #2"}
    ],
  }
